Title: Analysis of Informatics as a New Subject with the New Approach in Elementary and Secondary Education
Source title: Proceedings - 2020 International Symposium on Educational Technology, ISET 2020
Affiliations: Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Doringin, F., Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sapoetra, J., Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to examine whether the Informatics subject has good quality in terms of content and the readiness of schools and teachers. The paper uses a qualitative research method and discusses the availability of the material and the preparation of schools to use the Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) method in the Informatics as the new subject. STEM is a solution to encourage students to have skills that are suitable for the needs of the workplace today. The researcher collected the data using the literature study method, as well as the distribution of questionnaires and interviews with school leaders. This research shows that the content of the subject can meet STEM standards. Also, schools are ready to implement the Informatics in terms of system, teachers, and facilities. However, the government that launched the concept and asked the schools to implement the idea didn't support the school well and tended to push the autonomy of schools. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: curriculum; higher-order thinking skills (HOTS); problem solving; STEM; Technology 4.0
Index Keywords: Educational technology; Informatics; Students; Surveys; Literature studies; New approaches; Qualitative research methods; School leaders; Science , technology , engineering , and mathematics; STEM (science, technology, engineering and mathematics)

Title: An Analysis of Local Content in the Local English Textbooks in Indonesian High Schools
Affiliations: Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Sapoetra, J., Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Local content is one way to promote local wisdom in a country. Indonesia, being a very big and plural country, has a tremendous local wisdom that can promote the country in many aspects: political, economic, cultural, and in the educational sector. One of the main issues in the local wisdom is the local content. This research is trying to investigate the local content found in the reading passages in the local English textbooks used in Indonesian high schools. The research shows that many local English textbooks do not include local content in their reading passages. The problem arises due to the fact that many authors and or publishers are not aware of the importance of such local wisdom in their textbook writing. Another problem is due to the hegemony of so called the ideology of political identity within one nation which affects the philosophy of textbook writing in the respected country. By doing the research, it is hoped that many Indonesian authors write the reading passages which promote the local content in order to highlight the local wisdom of the country to other countries in the world. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Engineering education; Educational sectors; High school; Indonesia; Local contents; Textbooks

Authors: Rombot O., Sapoetra J., Mirayani R.
Title: The effect of positive discipline method on the student’s self regulatory skills and interpersonal skills of the students of the first grade class at quantum change academy
Authors with affiliations: Rombot, O., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Sapoetra, J., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Mirayani, R., Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This research concentrates on the role of positive discipline method in the effect on first grade students’ self regulatory skills and interpersonal skills. The form of discipline is a non punitive method that will shape and adjust the behavior of the six students in the first grade at Quantum Change Academy who are still in transition stage that are very impulsive and inattentive. The purpose of the study is to analyze the effect of the positive discipline method on the students’ self regulatory skills and interpersonal skills. It is a mixed-methods research that is when qualitative and quantitative methods are given equal priority and at once. The research was based on the verified information with triangulation data collections consisting of checklist of Self regulatory skills and Interpersonal skills, field observation by video recording and informal interview with the parents and the homeroom teacher and parents’ questionnaire and students’simple self-assessment. The result of the treatment of Positive Discipline Method, Which was done in six weeks produced a considerable effect on students’ self regulatory skills and interpersonal skills. The students were able to get along with peers and able to work autonomously, and those two indicators could be concluded that they were egocentric at first, however they were able to work together cordially at the end. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers.
Author Keywords: Interpersonal skills; Nonpunitive method; Positive discipline method; Self regulatory sills; Semi experimental qualitative research; Statistic descriptive
